question: The Wilpattu National Park (WNP) is located in which country?
explanation: The Wilpattu National Park (WNP) is  the largest and one of the oldest National Parks in Sri Lanka. The unique feature of this park is the existence of \"Willus\" (Natural lakes) - Natural, sand-rimmed water basins or depressions that fill with rainwater. The park is 1,317 square kilometers (131, 693 hectares) and ranges from 0 to 152 meters above sea level.  It is home to elephant, sloth bear, leopard, water buffalo, etc.  The most common reptiles found in the park are the monitor lizard, mugger crocodile, common cobra, rat snake, Indian python, pond turtle, etc. The best time to visit Wilpattu is during the months of February and October.
